section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Thus did Naam Dayv come to receive the Blessed Vision of the Lord's Darshan. ||4||3||

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

author.author: Saint Namdev
author.description:
Saint Namdev [1270 - 1350] was born in the state of Maharashtra village of Naras-Vamani, in Satara district (presently called Narsi Namdev). His father was called Damshet, a tailor, and his mother was called Gonabai.

The main spiritual message of Saint Namdev, just like the Sikh Gurus, was to emphasise the importance of living a married householder life and that through marriage, living in the world and meditating on God, one could attain enlightenment. Sixty-one of his hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. He was also a close friend of Saint Trilochan.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I am crazy - the Lord is my Husband.

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

author.author: Saint Namdev
author.description:

The main spiritual message of Saint Namdev, just like the Sikh Gurus, was to emphasise the importance of living a married householder life and that through marriage, living in the world and meditating on God, one could attain enlightenment. text: ਰਚਿ ਰਚਿ ਤਾ ਕਉ ਕਰਉ ਸਿੰਗਾਰੁ ॥੧॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I decorate and adorn myself for Him. ||1||

transliteration.text: rach rach tā kau karau singār .1.

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

text: ਭਲੇ ਨਿੰਦਉ ਭਲੇ ਨਿੰਦਉ ਭਲੇ ਨਿੰਦਉ ਲੋਗੁ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Slander me well, slander me well, slander me well, O people.

transliteration.text: bhalē nindau bhalē nindau bhalē nindau lōg .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

text: ਤਨੁ ਮਨੁ ਰਾਮ ਪਿਆਰੇ ਜੋਗੁ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: My body and mind are united with my Beloved Lord. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: tan man rām piārē jōg .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. text: ਬਾਦੁ ਬਿਬਾਦੁ ਕਾਹੂ ਸਿਉ ਨ ਕੀਜੈ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Do not engage in any arguments or debates with anyone.

transliteration.text: bād bibād kāhū siu n kījai .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: With your tongue, savor the Lord's sublime essence. ||2||

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. text: ਅਬ ਜੀਅ ਜਾਨਿ ਐਸੀ ਬਨਿ ਆਈ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Now, I know within my soul, that such an arrangement has been made;

transliteration.text: ab jī jān aisī ban āī .

translation.text: Anyone can praise or slander me.

translation.text: Naam Dayv has met the Lord. ||4||4||

text: ਕਬਹੂ ਖੀਰਿ ਖਾਡ ਘੀਉ ਨ ਭਾਵੈ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Sometimes, people do not appreciate milk, sugar and ghee.

transliteration.text: kabahū khīr khād ghīu n bhāvai .

text: ਜਿਉ ਰਾਮੁ ਰਾਖੈ ਤਿਉ ਰਹੀਐ ਰੇ ਭਾਈ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: As the Lord keeps us, so do we live, O Siblings of Destiny.

transliteration.text: jiu rām rākhai tiu rahīai rē bhāī .

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Lord's Glory cannot even be described. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: har kī mahimā kish kathan n jāī .1. rahāu .

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

Saint Namdev [1270 - 1350] was born in the state of Maharashtra village of Naras-Vamani, in Satara district (presently called Narsi Namdev). His father was called Damshet, a tailor, and his mother was called Gonabai.

The main spiritual message of Saint Namdev, just like the Sikh Gurus, was to emphasise the importance of living a married householder life and that through marriage, living in the world and meditating on God, one could attain enlightenment. Sixty-one of his hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. He was also a close friend of Saint Trilochan.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I am of a low social class, O Lord;

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

author.description:
Saint Namdev [1270 - 1350] was born in the state of Maharashtra village of Naras-Vamani, in Satara district (presently called Narsi Namdev). His father was called Damshet, a tailor, and his mother was called Gonabai.

The main spiritual message of Saint Namdev, just like the Sikh Gurus, was to emphasise the importance of living a married householder life and that through marriage, living in the world and meditating on God, one could attain enlightenment. Sixty-one of his hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. He was also a close friend of Saint Trilochan.
